page.title: 15Moreton Wood Farm
page.content: Moreton Wood Farm is built of bricks with a tiled roof,like most of the other farmhouses in the area.The farmer is a tenant farmer who employs 1 cowman,1 tractor driver and 1 student on a Y.T.S scheme. There are 14 fields which grow barley,wheat and grass.The fields have changed through the years because some hedges have been removed. The 150 Friesian cows are milked twice a day in a herring_bone milking parlour. They are fed on silage during the winter. There are also 30 heifers, 60 calves and 1 bull. Farm buildings include a grain silo,and two large sheds,in one of which are kept 3 tractors. A family of 6 people live in the farmhouse which has thirteen rooms and a large garden.
